Saint 'Bonaventure', O.F.M. (; 1221 â 15 July 1274),
born 'Giovanni di Fidanza', was an Italian medieval scholastic theologian and
philosopher. The seventh Minister General of the Order of Friars Minor, he was
also a Cardinal Bishop of Albano. He was canonised on 14 April 1482 by Pope
Sixtus IV and declared a Doctor of the Church in the year 1588 by Pope Sixtus V.
He is known as the "Seraphic Doctor" (). Many writings believed in the Middle
Ages to be his are now collected under the name Pseudo-Bonaventura.
categories: People from the Province of Viterbo
headings: Places, churches, and schools named in his honour
